required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Joint Planning in Paediatric Rehabilitation: Parent and Child Related Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: We will use one group, pretest-posttest research design. The intervention will have a 6-month timeframe. Up to 18 participants will be selected from active caseloads of the three to six participating healthcare providers in the Early Childhood Rehabilitation Program at the Alberta Children's Hospital, Child Development Centre site in Calgary Alberta. All data will be collected in Alberta using remote measures. Parents and therapists will complete surveys in an online portal. One measure needs to be completed in conjunction with the therapist and parent and will be done in person using an online portal. The researchers will have a local investigator (Debra Teitelbaum) in Calgary who works on-site to help manage data collection and recruitment in person if necessary.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: One group pre-test post-test design to evaluate a coaching model

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Canadian Occupational Performance Measure (COPM)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in COPM performance and satisfaction between baseline and 6-months.
primary_outcome.description: An evidence-based measure designed to capture a client's/familie's self-perception of performance in everyday living, their satisfaction with their performance, and changes in performance/satisfaction over time. It is one method of setting and measuring achievement of individualized therapeutic goals.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in MPOC (satisfaction) between baseline and 6-months.
secondary_outcome.description: Satisfaction with healthcare services - the MPOC is a self-report measure of parents' perceptions of the extent to which the health services they and their child(ren) receive are family-centred.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in PedsQL Family Impact Module between baseline and 6-months
Change in Parenting Stress Index between baseline and 6-months
Change in self-efficacy between baseline and 6-months
secondary_outcome.description: self efficacy rating of ability to carry out home exercises, 0-100mm line, higher equals more self-efficacy

secondary_outcome.measure: Therapist perceived parent efficacy Visual Analog Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in efficacy between baseline and 6-months
secondary_outcome.description: Therapist rated parent efficacy rating of ability to carry out home exercises, 0-100mm line, higher equals more efficacy

intervention.description: The Applied Coaching Model incorporates key learning opportunities and coaching strategies with evidence-based practices, approaches and theories and will serve as a tool for all healthcare providers wanting to implement coaching techniques within their practice.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Receiving care for developmental delay
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cannot speak or read english

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data can be requested from the PI and all requests will be considered on an individual basis
